label: Latrine type, current
definition: Type of pit latrine used by members of the household at the time of survey. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.

label: Latrine type, previous
definition: Type of pit latrine previously used, if the style of pit latrine used by members of the household at the time of survey was different than the type used when the participant was 0-2 years of age. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: If NO; type when pit latrine 0-2yrs. Source=TZH latrine. with slab = 1;with no slab = 2;others = 3

label: Sanitation score
definition: Whether the household sanitation facilities were classified as improved or unimproved, based on WHO definitions; 0 for unimproved categories, 4 for improved categories | Whether the household sanitation facilities were classified as improved or unimproved, based on WHO definitions. Sanitation facilities categorized as 'Improved' include those classified as 'Other,' 'Pit latrine without flush/with slab,''Flush to piped sewer system,' 'Flush to septic tank,' 'Flush to pit latrine,' or 'Flush to somewhere else.' 'No facility/bush/field or bucket toilet/pit latrine without slab' was considered 'Unimproved.' Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Score of sanitation; 0 for unimproved categories, 4 for improved categories | Score of sanitation; 0 for unimproved categories, 4 for improved categories. Source=FSE(derived). if fsetoiletmod = ''01'' then newsanitation=0, unimproved;if fsetoiletmod = ''02'',''03'',''04'',''05'',''06'',''07'' then newsanitation=4, improved
codebookValues:
if cef_toilet = 1 then newsanitation=0, unimproved
if cef_toilet = 2,3,4,5,6,7 then newsanitation=4, improved | , 0, 4

label: SHINE Latrine
definition: SHINE latrine present at month 12 follow up
codebookDescription: M12 SHINE latrine present?

label: Toilet or latrine
definition: Whether the household had a flush toilet or pit latrine. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Do you have a toilet in your household ?. Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00 | gb38: Is there a toilet or latrine of any type at the homestead?

label: Toilet or latrine concrete floor before Nov 2009
definition: For households with toilets or latrines that had a concrete floor, whether this concrete floor was available before November 2009. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Was the concrete floor available before November 2009?. Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Toilet or latrine concrete floor between Nov 2009 - Feb 2014
definition: For households with toilets or latrines that did NOT have a concrete floor, whether the household toilet or latrine had a concrete floor at any time between November 2009 and February 2014. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: If your answer to Question 04 is ‚ÄòNo‚Äô, did your toilet/latrine have a concrete floor any time between November 2009 and February 2014? . Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Toilet or latrine concrete floor date
definition: Installation date for the household toilet or latrine's concrete floor, if after November 2009. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: When after November 2009 did your toilet/latrine; have a concrete floor. Source=SAV Latrine. date

label: Toilet or latrine has concrete floor
definition: Whether the household toilet or latrine had a concrete floor. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Does your household toilet/latrine have a concrete floor?. Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Toilet or latrine type
definition: Type of toilet or latrine facility usually used by members of the household. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use? Equal to FSE toilet except when new data provided by TZH, SAV, and PEL conflict. It is preferable to use this variable than the raw variable as correct accounting for type of latrine has been made. . Source=Derived. no facility/bush/field or bucket toilet/pit latrine without slab = 01(unimproved);pit latrine without flush/with slab(improved) = 02;flush to piped sewer system = 03 flush to septic tank = 04 ;flush to pit latrine = 05 ;flush to somewhere else = 06;other = 07
